SUBJECT: Original Oriental Secrets
TITLE: Simplex Coat and Tape Release
DESCRIPTION: An impressive release of your suit jacket, that has been looped through rope.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: tape tied through coat is released

SUBJECT: Original Oriental Secrets
TITLE: Japanese Multiple Tape Tie
DESCRIPTION: A quick penetration of two shoelaces through a volunteer's wrists.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: Two assistance tied and released (walking through rope)

SUBJECT: Original Oriental Secrets
TITLE: Ching Ling Foo's Master Tape Mystery
DESCRIPTION: An unbelievably convincing cut and restored ribbon.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: A piece of tape, two assistants, and a pair of scissors. The tape is stretched taut and cut in half with the scissors. The magician then mysteriously restores the tape to one piece.

SUBJECT: Original Oriental Secrets
TITLE: Clippo
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: A long piece of cloth tape is held taut between two assistants. The magician cuts the tape in half with scissors, then holds the two cut ends far apart. After bringing the ends back together, they are tied in a loose knot. The magician fans the knot with a fan, the knot is untied, and the tape is whole again. Tape is examinable

SUBJECT: Original Oriental Secrets
TITLE: Ching Ling Foo's Royal Tape Mystery
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: A long piece of cloth tape is held taut between two assistants. The magician cuts the tape in half with scissors, then holds the two cut ends far apart. After bringing the ends back together, they are tied in a loose knot. The magician fans the knot with a fan, the knot is untied, and the tape is whole again.

SUBJECT: Original Oriental Secrets
TITLE: The Chinese Burning Tapes
DESCRIPTION: Burned and restored shoelaces.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: The performer shows two lengths of tape and has them held at each end by assistants. The center of the tapes are lit on fire and the tapes separate. The magician extinguishes the flames and brings the burnt ends together. The tapes are then mysteriously restored into one complete piece.

SUBJECT: Original Oriental Secrets
TITLE: Hindu Turban Mystery
DESCRIPTION: A neat new handling for a cut and restored cash register tape.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: A magician has his wrists tied together with a length of rope. He then covers his hands with a cloth, and when he removes the cloth, the rope has been removed from his wrists and is now tied around the cloth!

SUBJECT: Original Oriental Secrets
TITLE: Chinese "Chefalo" Knot
DESCRIPTION: A complicated-looking knot that unties itself.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: A long piece of tape is shown and one end is held by an assistant. The magician ties a series of knots in the tape. Upon command, the knots dissolve in mid-air leaving the tape straight.

SUBJECT: Original Oriental Secrets
TITLE: Chinese Ring on the Tape
DESCRIPTION: An unusual move for a ring and string routine.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: A large ring and a long piece of cloth tape are shown. The middle of the tape is threaded through the ring and a knot is tied. One end of the tape is given to an assistant while the magician holds the other. In an instant, the ring is seen to be hanging on the tape inside the loop formed by the knot.

SUBJECT: Tarbell Hindu Rope Mysteries
TITLE: Tarbell Hindu Rope Mystery
DESCRIPTION: A long piece of clothesline is tied in a circle, cut in half, and cleanly restored. The routine can be repeated and the rope can be given away as a souvenir.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: A rope is cut and restored twice. A spectator cuts the rope in the center, and pieces are trimmed from the ends to prove it is truly cut. The magician then restores the rope, only to have it cut again and restored once more. Finally, the fully restored rope is tossed into the audience for examination.

SUBJECT: Tarbell Hindu Rope Mysteries
TITLE: The "Bombay" & the "Calcutta" Method
DESCRIPTION: A single piece of rope is clearly cut into two equal pieces. With no suspicious moves, the rope rejoins into one piece. Then, the spectator cuts it anywhere she wants, and it is restored back to a single piece of rope.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: In "The Bombay Method," a spectator cuts a rope in half, and pieces are trimmed from the ends to prove the cut. The magician then restores the rope to one piece. - In "The Calcutta Method," the rope is also cut in half by a spectator, and all four ends are trimmed. Despite this, the magician is able to instantly restore the rope to its original, uncut state.

SUBJECT: Tarbell Hindu Rope Mysteries
TITLE: The "Inner Circle" Rope Mystery & the "Delhi" Method
DESCRIPTION: You will learn how to cut a rope into three pieces (that famously change lengths) and instantly make them join back into one long rope. Plus, you can move a cut-off piece from one end of a rope to the other and it still rejoins.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: In "The Inner Circle Rope Mystery," the magician forms a loop in the center of the rope and has a spectator cut through it. This results in three pieces of rope. The magician then mysteriously restores the rope to one piece. - In "The Delhi Method," the magician forms a loop in the rope and has it cut.  The rope is shown to be in three pieces. The magician then restores the rope to its original length in a comedic fashion.

SUBJECT: Tarbell Hindu Rope Mysteries
TITLE: Emergency Loop Method
DESCRIPTION: A variation of the Tarbell Hindu Rope Mystery that uses a normal rope.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: This method is a simplified rope trick that can be performed without any special gimmicks. A rope is shown tied into a loop and then cut in the center. Despite being seemingly cut, the rope is quickly restored to its original looped form. This trick is designed to be easy to perform and can be done impromptu.

SUBJECT: Modern Rope Magic
TITLE: Tony Lopilato's Rope-Saver
DESCRIPTION: A cord, wrapped around a package, is cut off and the knot, joining the two pieces, vanishes so the rope may be used again.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: A magician presents a box tied with a rope in a way that the rope goes around both ways. He explains that usually when untying such packages, the rope becomes too short to be reused. However, he has a solution - a "rope-saver". He proceeds to cut the rope twice to remove it from the box, and then mysteriously restores the rope to its original, full length, allowing it to be used again.

SUBJECT: Modern Rope Magic
TITLE: The Tony Lopilato Knot
DESCRIPTION: An easy-to-remember, but complicated-looking, knot that's even easier to get rid of.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: Dissolving knot

SUBJECT: Modern Rope Magic
TITLE: The Double Knotter
DESCRIPTION: A strange way to tie two knots at the same time.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: Appearance of two knots

SUBJECT: Modern Rope Magic
TITLE: Tony Lopilato's Ring on the Rope
DESCRIPTION: A ring is borrowed, vanishes, and reappears on a rope that is tied around your spectator.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: Ring disappears in handkerchief, reappears on rope

SUBJECT: Modern Rope Magic
TITLE: Tony Lopilato's "Book Mark"
DESCRIPTION: A short piece of rope is used as a bookmark. Then stretches into a much longer piece.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: A magician shows a short piece of rope and uses it as a bookmark in a book. He then takes a longer piece of rope, cuts it in half, and magically restores it. Finally, he makes the longer rope disappear. When he pulls the bookmark out of the book, it has transformed into the longer rope!

SUBJECT: Modern Rope Magic
TITLE: Tarbell's Rings and Growing Rope
DESCRIPTION: An object, trapped on a short rope, is mysteriously freed while the ends remain in view. Then the rope grows.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: Wooden rings penetrate rope which grows

SUBJECT: Modern Rope Magic
TITLE: Judge Lynch's Necktie Party
DESCRIPTION: A rope tied around your neck and threaded through your jacket seems to melt right through everything, but takes your tie off as it does.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: Grandmother's necklace - principle, tie appears on rope

SUBJECT: Magic of the Bambergs
TITLE: The Frogs, the Fish, and the Bowl of Water
DESCRIPTION: A modernized method to effortlessly produce live fish.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: Production of frogs and fish

SUBJECT: Magic of the Bambergs
TITLE: The Broken and Restored Clay Pipe
DESCRIPTION: A broken and restored party horn makes for a funny, and surprising, emcee gag.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: Five white pipes on one hand, five blue pipes on other hand, transposition

SUBJECT: Magic of the Bambergs
TITLE: The Boomerang Coins
DESCRIPTION: Every time you figure out your helper's card, you get a chip, but they somehow always return back. Until the chips and cards become solid blocks.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: Coins/metal discs are counted and number increases and diminishes, using tray

SUBJECT: Magic of the Bambergs
TITLE: David Tobias Banberg's Egg Bag
DESCRIPTION: A version of the egg bag you've never seen before. Produce a full dozen eggs, and the whole chicken.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: Large bag, fifteen eggs produced and a live hen

SUBJECT: Magic of the Bambergs
TITLE: Okito's Tea, Milk, and Sugar Mystery
DESCRIPTION: A complete magic routine where you transform paper shreds into coffee and cream.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: Paper transforms into tea, milk and sugar in cans and cups

SUBJECT: Magic of the Bambergs
TITLE: Fu Manchu's Phantom Bag Escape
DESCRIPTION: An instantaneous escape from an ungimmicked cloth bag, examined before and after.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: Escape from large bag

SUBJECT: Magic of the Bambergs
TITLE: DL Bamberg's Change-over Clay Pipes
DESCRIPTION: five white pipes on one hand, five blue pipes on other hand, transposition
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: The magician shows some white pipes and some blue pipes. By just moving their hands around, the magician makes the white pipes and blue pipes switch places!

SUBJECT: Magic with Bowls and Liquids
TITLE: Production of a Large Bowl of Water
DESCRIPTION: Learn how to make the special costume for the production of a large cooler full of ice and beer.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: Bowl of water production. Body load, chinese costume

SUBJECT: Magic with Bowls and Liquids
TITLE: Production of Stack of Four Bowls of Water, Chinese Production of the Four Bowls
DESCRIPTION: Using the same costume, you'll learn how to produce tall stacks of many bowls filled with colorful water; Using the same gimmick as the previous production, you'll learn how to produce tall stacks of many bowls filled without a special costume.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: Multiple bowl of water produced. Stage

SUBJECT: Magic with Bowls and Liquids
TITLE: Production of a Child
DESCRIPTION: Learn how to produce a small child, instantly on stage, with only a cloth and a chair. This brand new method requires none of the previous cumbersome contraptions and costumes, and it's adaptable to just about any stage.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: Child appears from nowhere.  Using body loading and chinese costume

SUBJECT: Magic with Bowls and Liquids
TITLE: Modern Production of a Bowl of Water on a Table
DESCRIPTION: Produce a large fisbowl from thin air. You will learn all the details on how to construct a special table for this killer production.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: Bowl of water production. Gaffed table

SUBJECT: Magic with Bowls and Liquids
TITLE: The Vanishing Bowl of Water
DESCRIPTION: You'll learn all the work on the once-popular vanishing bowl of water, with an all new handling.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: Bowl of water vanishes. Using assistant

SUBJECT: Magic with Bowls and Liquids
TITLE: Chinese Production of Doves
DESCRIPTION: A fun and interesting way to produce a small live animal.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: Dove production using bowl.

SUBJECT: Impromptu Tricks
TITLE: The Penetrating Ring
DESCRIPTION: Ring penetrates through rubberband on your finger.  Rubberband is set-up similar to Jumping Rubber Band.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: Ring penetrates rubber band.

SUBJECT: Impromptu Tricks
TITLE: The Jumping Rubber Band
DESCRIPTION: Rubberband jumps from first two fingers to third and fourth fingers
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: A rubber band jumps from finger to finger

SUBJECT: Impromptu Tricks
TITLE: Metal Ring on a String & Patriotic Ring on a String
DESCRIPTION: Solid key is pulled off of string. Performer removes named card from string while other cards remain.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: You let someone look at a metal ring and a piece of string. They put the ring on the string and hold the ends of the string. You cover the ring with a handkerchief, and when you take the handkerchief away, the ring is gone! - The magician has a red, white, and blue ring, and a piece of string. Two people hold the ends of the string, and the magician puts the rings on the string.  He covers the rings with a handkerchief, and then makes one of the rings disappear!

SUBJECT: Impromptu Tricks
TITLE: The Penetrative Cigar Band
DESCRIPTION: pretzel is pulled off of string.  Spectator has no clue how to do it, but rest of audience sees it
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: Selected colored ring is magically removed from rope

SUBJECT: Impromptu Tricks
TITLE: The Vanishing Ring on String
DESCRIPTION: Knot is magically removed from rope.  Spectator is fooled.  Audience sees it.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: Cigar band magically removed from rope

SUBJECT: Impromptu Tricks
TITLE: Cut and Restored Cord Effects Kellar's Cut and Restored Cord
DESCRIPTION: Cut and restored rope using wax adhesive (not inspectable)
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: In "Cut and Restored Cord Effect," the rope is cut in the middle, and the two pieces are shown to be completely separate. Then, the magician ties the two ends together, and the rope is instantly back to one piece! - "Kellar's Cut and Restored Cord" is similar, but the magician holds the two pieces of rope far apart to really show that they are separate.  Even though the rope was clearly cut in half, the magician is able to put it back together into one piece.

SUBJECT: Impromptu Tricks
TITLE: Comedy Version of Germain Cord Effect
DESCRIPTION: Cut and restored rope using cable cord (inspectable)
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: 30' wrapping cord cut and restored

SUBJECT: Impromptu Tricks
TITLE: An Impromptu Cut and Restored Cord Effect
DESCRIPTION: Classic Cut and restored rope. Spectator cuts rope in center but ropes are not same length.  Spectator cuts one to make them same length, but they are still not same length.  Magician just restores rope to one whole rope to start over.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: Cut and restored rope effect totally impromptu

SUBJECT: Illusions
TITLE: The Egyptian Mummy
DESCRIPTION: A packing crate for some Egyptian artifacts, shown otherwise empty, is used to bring the Egyptian Queen back to life.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: Mummy changes to person in cabinet

SUBJECT: Illusions
TITLE: Bonus Routine
DESCRIPTION: Displaying an ornate armoire, containing a single suit, Harlan slowly makes his appearance as though growing out of the suit itself.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: Not in Book

SUBJECT: Publicity and Promotion
DESCRIPTION: - Marketing for magicians.- Establishing trust with your clients.- Making a promo video.- Identifying your market.- Individualizing your product.- Re-investing in yourself.- Starting up, and promoting your own show.- Much More.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: How to make money as a professional magician. It says that talent is important, but you also need to know how to run a business. This includes things like putting on a good show, advertising, and getting along with people. The most important thing is to have a good product that people will pay for.

SUBJECT: Novel Ball Magic
TITLE: Billiard Ball through Handkerchief
DESCRIPTION: A quick, visual bit where a ball seems to melt halfway through a silk handkerchief which can even be pulled back and forth through the center of the ball.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: The magician wraps a billiard ball in a handkerchief. Then, just by pulling on the handkerchief, the magician makes it look like the handkerchief goes right through the ball!

SUBJECT: Novel Ball Magic
TITLE: Balls from the Air (Methods 1 & 2)
DESCRIPTION: Learn how to pluck a seemingly endless supply of strange spheres from the air, and vanish them just as easily.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: The magician uses a paper cone and catches invisible balls from the air! Each time a ball is caught, it drops into the cone with a clink. At the end, the cone is crumpled up and the balls have vanished.

SUBJECT: Novel Ball Magic
TITLE: Balls from the Air (Method 3)
DESCRIPTION: An Easter themed routine that allows you to catch a basketful of eggs which then transform into many bright colors. No bunny required.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: The magician uses a paper cone and catches invisible balls from the air! Each time a ball is caught, it drops into the cone with a clink. At the end, the cone is crumpled up and the balls have vanished.

SUBJECT: Novel Ball Magic
TITLE: McLemore's "Stop-Go"
DESCRIPTION: A very unique routine where balls of yarn move on their own.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: A magician ties a red ball and a green ball to a string hung between two chairs. While sitting on the floor and unable to touch them, the magician makes the balls swing back and forth on their own! First the red ball swings, then it stops and the green ball swings, then the green ball stops and the red ball swings again, and so on. It looks like the magician is controlling the balls with magic!

SUBJECT: Novel Ball Magic
TITLE: Senator Clark Crandall's Cup and Balls
DESCRIPTION: Chop-Cup-style routine using a completely ungimmicked cup and three sneaky grapes.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: This is a magic trick with just one cup and three small balls. The magician makes the balls disappear one by one, and then they mysteriously reappear inside the cup! Even though the cup is shown to be empty at the beginning, the magician somehow makes the balls appear inside it with his magic.

SUBJECT: Novel Ball Magic
TITLE: Tarbell's "Flower Pots and Oranges"
DESCRIPTION: Tarbell's re-imagined version of the venerable classic Cups and Balls, suitable for stand-up and stage.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: The magician shows three flower pots stacked on top of each other. He takes them apart to show they are all empty. He then puts them back together and makes oranges appear and disappear under the pots! The oranges even seem to magically jump from one pot to another.

SUBJECT: Unique Card Effects
TITLE: Jump Up Card
DESCRIPTION: A quick card revelation where the selection pops from the middle of the deck isolated in the box.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: A card is chosen from a deck and put back in. The magician puts the deck in a card box. With a magical gesture, the chosen card jumps right out of the box!

SUBJECT: Unique Card Effects
TITLE: Reneaux' Card in the Envelope
DESCRIPTION: A signed selected card disappears from the deck, and impossibly appears sealed inside an envelope in your jacket pocket.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: Someone chooses a card and the magician puts it back in the deck. The card disappears from the deck. The magician takes a sealed envelope from his pocket, tears it open, and inside is the chosen card!

SUBJECT: Unique Card Effects
TITLE: Stanley Palm's Ghost Cards
DESCRIPTION: Find a selected card while the deck is wrapped in a cloth, then, make the entire deck vanish!
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: The magician counts out ten cards and asks someone to think of one. The cards are placed under a handkerchief. One by one, the magician removes cards from under the handkerchief, but none of them are the chosen card. Finally, the magician takes away the handkerchief to reveal that all the other cards have vanished!

SUBJECT: Unique Card Effects
TITLE: Palhinha's Wherizit
DESCRIPTION: A multi-phase monte routine with a kicker ending using an updated gimmick you can make at home.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: The magician shows three cards and asks someone to think of one. They cover the cards with a handkerchief. When the magician removes the handkerchief, the card the person was thinking of has disappeared!

SUBJECT: Unique Card Effects
TITLE: Haxton's One Chance in Eight
DESCRIPTION: A fun, impromptu, interactive elimination trick where both you and your spectator find her card.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: The magician places eight cards in their pocket, one of which is the spectator's chosen card. The magician then asks the spectator to remove one card from their pocket without revealing it. The magician also removes a card from their pocket and places it face down on their other hand. The two of you then take turns removing cards from the magician's pocket, one at a time, until only one card remains. The spectator is asked to name their chosen card, and when they do, the magician reveals that it is the card that remains in their pocket.

SUBJECT: Unique Card Effects
TITLE: Francis Haxton's "Inspired"
DESCRIPTION: An unexpected, single card across which vanishes from under one helper's hand while another cuts right to it where it just shouldn't be.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: The magician appears to control objects with their mind. They can make objects move and levitate without any physical contact.

SUBJECT: Unique Card Effects
TITLE: Maldo's Six Card Mystery
DESCRIPTION: A classic six card repeat routine that makes use of some interesting counting techniques.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: The magician counts six cards, then places three of them into a basket. When they count the remaining cards, there are still six! This is repeated several times, ending with a surprising finish where the magician turns three cards into six.

SUBJECT: Unique Card Effects
TITLE: Berland's Six Card Repeat Mystery
DESCRIPTION: A truly impossible poker hand repeat, updated for maximum visibility and impact with a color-changing backs kicker ending.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: A magician counts six cards, then throws three away, but still has six left. This impossible feat is repeated several times, creating a baffling mystery.

SUBJECT: Unique Card Effects
TITLE: Crandall's One Hand Six Card Repeat
DESCRIPTION: This One-Handed Repeat routine is used as the perfect comedic lead-in to a card stab finale... with a Frisbee.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: A magician counts six cards and places them on a plate. They tell a story, occasionally dropping a card, but when they count the cards again, there are still six! This is repeated, creating a puzzling situation where the number of cards seems to defy logic.

SUBJECT: Unique Card Effects
TITLE: Hen Fetsch's Card in Balloon
DESCRIPTION: A fantastic impromptu, ungimmicked card from balloon routine.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: A card is chosen and returned to the deck. The deck is placed in a card case and a balloon is inflated. With a burst of the balloon, the card case falls away, and the selected card is left standing upright!

SUBJECT: Unique Card Effects
TITLE: Rawson Card Reading
DESCRIPTION: A special gimmick you can make at home, that allows you to secretly glimpse the bottom card of a cased deck.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: A spectator shuffles a deck of cards and looks at the bottom card. They place the deck in a card case, and the magician instantly knows the name of the card!

SUBJECT: Unique Card Effects
TITLE: Tarbell Card Reading
DESCRIPTION: A modern update to a special gimmick you can make at home, that allows you to secretly glimpse the bottom card of a cased deck.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: A spectator cuts a deck of cards, looks at the bottom card, and places the deck in a card case. The magician instantly knows the name of the card!

SUBJECT: Unique Card Effects
TITLE: The Gambler's Rehearsal
DESCRIPTION: A complete gambling demonstration, requiring no skill, but making you look like an expert who can produce any winning hand any time you want.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: A magician demonstrates their poker-dealing skills by dealing five hands. They then deal themselves a winning hand - a straight. This is repeated with increasingly better hands, culminating in a royal flush for the magician.

SUBJECT: Novelty Magic Vol 1
TITLE: Al Sharpe's "Two Ribbon Cut"
DESCRIPTION: Barehand, cut-and-restored, double-ribbon trick with a surprising ending.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: A magician displays two different colored ribbons. They cut both ribbons in half, then instantly restore them to their original condition.

SUBJECT: Novelty Magic Vol 1
TITLE: The Switch-Over Knot
DESCRIPTION: A tightly tied square knot seems to melt from one place to another.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: A magician ties two different colored handkerchiefs together with a knot. They then introduce a third handkerchief. Suddenly, the knot seems to have switched to the first and third handkerchiefs!

SUBJECT: Novelty Magic Vol 1
TITLE: Grant's Ghost Knot
DESCRIPTION: A great rope utility gimmick that allows knots to vanish from its center.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: A magician ties a knot in a piece of rope. They hold the rope at both ends, and the knot mysteriously vanishes! The rope is now a single, straight piece.

SUBJECT: Novelty Magic Vol 1
TITLE: George Blake's "Uncanny Hanks"
DESCRIPTION: Treasures untie themselves from a rope on your command. Complete upgrade to the original method.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: A magician displays two silk handkerchiefs, one red and one white. They roll the handkerchiefs together, and when they unroll them, the white handkerchief has vanished, leaving only the red one.

SUBJECT: Novelty Magic Vol 1
TITLE: Graham Adams' Ring, Chair and Rope
DESCRIPTION: A ring and rope trick that plays huge, with your spectator at the center of it all.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: A spectator sits in a chair, holding a ring with a rope threaded through it. The magician passes the rope around the chair, and gives the ends to two other spectators. When they pull the rope, it seems to pass right through the chair, the spectator, and the ring!

SUBJECT: Novelty Magic Vol 1
TITLE: Bob Elis' Miser's Dream with Dollar Bills
DESCRIPTION: Learn to produce as much cash as you want, right at your fingertips.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: A magician reaches into the air and produces a dollar bill. They do this several times, eventually holding a fan of bills in each hand.

SUBJECT: Novelty Magic Vol 1
TITLE: Blackstar's Mystic Match Box 1, 2, 3
DESCRIPTION: Two great puzzle routines where you release a box from a strip of paper.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: A matchbox and a ribbon are displayed. The ribbon is threaded through the matchbox, yet the magician can remove the matchbox from the ribbon without untying or cutting it!

SUBJECT: Novelty Magic Vol 1
TITLE: Novel Coin Vanish
DESCRIPTION: A great coin vanish you can do with any handkerchief.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: A coin is placed in the center of a handkerchief. The handkerchief is folded over, and when it's shaken out, the coin has vanished!

SUBJECT: Novelty Magic Vol 1
TITLE: Vanishing Beer
DESCRIPTION: A new routine for an old idea, that contains a bit more magic, and gets away from the all-too-common presentation
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: A bottle of beer is placed into a paper bag. The bag is crumpled up, and when it's opened again, the bottle has vanished!

SUBJECT: Novelty Magic Vol 1
TITLE: Tan Hock Chuan's Silk Through the Glass
DESCRIPTION: Pull a handkerchief right through the bottom of a thoroughly examined, completely ungimmicked glass container.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: A yellow and red silk handkerchief are placed in a glass. The glass is covered with a white handkerchief and secured with a rubber band. The magician then pulls the yellow silk through the bottom of the glass, leaving the red silk still inside.

SUBJECT: Novelty Magic Vol 2
TITLE: Tarbell Phantom Sticker
DESCRIPTION: A use for a sticker as an extra convincer during an envelope switch.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: A stack of envelopes is shown. The top envelope, which has a sticker on it, contains a dollar bill. The top envelope is switched for another envelope, which also contains a dollar bill. The second envelope has a sticker on it.

SUBJECT: Novelty Magic Vol 2
TITLE: Eighteen Card Mystery
DESCRIPTION: A great cards across routine utilizing the Tarbell Phantom Sticker.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: Nine playing cards are counted by a spectator and placed into an envelope. The envelope is sealed and marked with a red sticker. A second spectator counts nine cards and places them into another envelope, which is sealed and marked with a blue sticker. Upon command, three cards pass from the first envelope into the second envelope.

SUBJECT: Novelty Magic Vol 2
TITLE: Here's Your Change
DESCRIPTION: A clever bill transposition with a surprise ending utilizing the Tarbell Phantom Sticker.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: A five dollar bill is borrowed and placed into an empty envelope. The envelope is sealed and marked with a red sticker. Another empty envelope is marked with a blue sticker. The magician states he will cause the five dollar bill to leave the red envelope and pass to the blue envelope. The assistant at the right opens the blue envelope and finds a one dollar bill. The five dollar bill has vanished. The magician says, "Here's your change." The five dollar bill is given to the person who lent the five dollars.

SUBJECT: Novelty Magic Vol 2
TITLE: Fantus Cards
DESCRIPTION: A thought of card appears in an envelope, utilizing the Tarbell Phantom Sticker.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: Five cards are fanned and a spectator is requested to remember three of them. The cards are placed in an envelope which is then sealed. The magician shows his right hand empty. The spectator names the three cards he thought of, one at a time. As he names each card, the magician reaches into his right trouser pocket and removes that card.

SUBJECT: Novelty Magic Vol 2
TITLE: Tarbell Travelling Sticker
DESCRIPTION: Vanish a chosen sticker and have it re-appear on a borrowed business card.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: An envelope is shown empty and a business card is placed inside. The flap of the envelope is sealed. A sticker is stuck to a blank card. The sticker disappears from the blank card and appears inside the envelope, stuck to the business card. Only a single envelope is required.

SUBJECT: Novelty Magic Vol 2
TITLE: Fu Manchu's Utility Bag
DESCRIPTION: Use the magic 8 ball to reveal a chosen card. Then, flatten the ball using this deceptive utility bag.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: A paper grocery bag of medium size is brought forward and an orange, ball, or other object is dropped into the bag. The bag is then blown up and burst, crushed into a ball and tossed to one side. The object placed inside has vanished.

SUBJECT: Novelty Magic Vol 2
TITLE: Grant's Cigarette Classic
DESCRIPTION: Incredibly clean vanish and re-appearance of a cigarette.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: A cigarette is placed behind a playing card. The cigarette vanishes and the card is torn into pieces. The magician reaches into his pocket and removes a package of cigarettes. The magician then removes the same lighted cigarette from the package of cigarettes.

SUBJECT: Novelty Magic Vol 2
TITLE: Royal Cigarette Vanish
DESCRIPTION: Complete vanish of a borrowed cigarette.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: A cigarette is placed behind a playing card. The cigarette vanishes. The card is dropped onto the table.

SUBJECT: Novelty Magic Vol 2
TITLE: Sands-Van Slyker "Birds of a Feather"
DESCRIPTION: Coin assembly using only four ungimmicked coins and an unprepared handkerchief.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: Four coins are placed, one on each corner of a handkerchief. The upper left corner of the handkerchief is turned back, and the coin is found to have disappeared. The coin is shown to have found its way invisibly under the right hand upper corner. The other two coins find their way, one at a time, to join the other two.

SUBJECT: Novelty Magic Vol 2
TITLE: Tarbell "Bank Night Cardboard and Envelope"
DESCRIPTION: Incredibly versatile and deceptive technique which allows you to cleanly remove a folded bill, or billet, from an envelope, even though it was never really inside.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: Several envelopes are spread out on a board or tray. A dollar bill is concealed inside a piece of white cardboard. Members of the audience freely select an envelope, leaving one for the performer. Upon opening their envelopes, the audience members find they have a blank piece of paper. The performer opens his envelope and finds a dollar bill.

SUBJECT: Novelty Magic Vol 2
TITLE: Tarbell's Magnetic Card and Envelope
DESCRIPTION: A shredded, borrowed credit card restored in a secluded envelope.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: A small commercial-size envelope is shown empty and sealed.  A card is freely selected from a deck of cards.  The card is pressed against the envelope for a moment to create a magnetic influence.  The card is placed into the right trousers pocket. The pocket is shown empty.  The envelope is cut open with scissors.  The card is withdrawn halfway, and the envelope is shown on both sides to show the card is withdrawn from inside the envelope.  Finally, the selected card is removed.

SUBJECT: Rope Magic
TITLE: Bob Elis' Vishnu Rope Mystery
DESCRIPTION: A smooth way to convincingly cut a length of rope into three pieces and restore them back to one by trimming off the knots.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: A seven-foot length of white, soft clothesline and a pair of scissors are shown.  Holding up one end of the rope, the performer cuts the rope into two parts, about two-thirds of the way down.  The ends are tied together.  Then, holding up the center of the longer piece of rope with the scissors, it is also cut in half.  The rope has been cut into three pieces.  The newly-cut ends are also tied together.  The two free ends are tied together in a knot, making the rope into a circle.  The knots are cut away, and the rope is restored to one piece.

SUBJECT: Rope Magic
TITLE: Denhart Ring on the Rope
DESCRIPTION: A puzzling way to thread a ring on a rope with the ends secured around someone's wrists.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: A four-foot piece of soft, white clothesline or tape is tied, one end around each of the performer's wrists.  A fruit jar rubber ring is shown, which can be marked if desired.  The performer turns away from the audience for a moment.  When the performer turns back, the fruit jar rubber ring is found on the center of the rope.  The performer turns away from the audience again.  When the performer turns back, the ring is found to be tied in a knot in the center of the rope.

SUBJECT: Rope Magic
TITLE: Hindu Ring on the Rope
DESCRIPTION: A classic ring on string trick with yet another method and a delayed reveal.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: A four-foot piece of soft, white clothesline or tape is shown. One end of the rope is tied around each of the performer's wrists. A fruit jar rubber ring is shown, which can be marked if desired. The performer steps back a few paces, and the fruit jar rubber ring is found on the center of the rope. The performer steps back again, and the ring is found to be tied in a knot in the center of the rope.

SUBJECT: Rope Magic
TITLE: Peter Warlock's Ring and Rope Release
DESCRIPTION: A simplified update of a convincing ring release from a tied loop.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: A solid metal ring, such as is used in the Linking Rings, is threaded onto a five-foot length of soft clothesline.  The two ends of the rope are securely knotted together.  The ring hangs in the center of the rope.  In an instant, the ring is pulled free of the knotted loop of rope.  Both the ring and the rope can be freely examined.

SUBJECT: Rope Magic
TITLE: EZ Cut and Restored Rope Mystery
DESCRIPTION: A full cut and restored rope routine containing "Another Ending for Zella Ring on the Rope" & "Zella Ring on the Rope"
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: A length of rope is shown and a spectator ties the ends of the rope together in a secure knot.  A metal ring, or a borrowed bracelet, is passed onto the rope even though the two ends of the rope are tied.  The spectator unties the rope ends and the ring, or bracelet, is allowed to slide off the rope.  Again the ring, or bracelet, is slid onto the rope and the two ends of the rope are retied by a spectator.  The performer pulls the ring or bracelet free from the rope without untying the knot.  Three large metal or harness rings are examined and passed onto the rope.  The rope is untied to remove the rings.  The rope and the rings may be handed out for examination.

SUBJECT: Rope Magic
TITLE: Grant's Bombay Ropes and Rings
DESCRIPTION: Straighten out a tangled mess you make with the help of two volunteers, so they can both get exactly what they want.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: Two lengths of white, soft clothesline are shown and laid over the opening of an upturned hat.  The center of the ropes is pushed down into the hat.  Three black metal rings are threaded over two of the ropes and pushed down into the hat.  Three more black rings are placed on the opposite two ends and pushed down into the hat.  The ropes are lifted to show that the six rings are thereon.  A nickel-plated ring is threaded over two of the ends, and it, too, is pushed down into the hat.  Another nickel ring is slipped over the other two ends and pushed down into the hat.  Two of the ends are given to a spectator at the left, while the other two ends are held by a spectator at the right.  The ropes with the rings threaded thereon are lifted above the hat.  Choice is given of either the black or the nickel-plated rings.  The chosen rings mysteriously fall off the rope into the hat, leaving the other rings on the ropes.

SUBJECT: Rope Magic
TITLE: Tarbell's Linking Rope Ring Routine
DESCRIPTION: Four loops of rope, tied by you and your helper, are mysteriously linked together.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: Four rope rings, made of soft white clothesline, about eight inches in diameter, are shown separately.  Two of the rope rings suddenly become linked, one within the other.  The linked rope rings are given to a spectator, who will be unable to take them apart without untying the rope.  The linking process is illustrated with the remaining two rings, which are shown separately and then mysteriously linked together.  Then all four of the rings are linked together in a chain.  Finally, all of the ropes are separated.

SUBJECT: Mind Reading Mysteries Vol 1
TITLE: Parrish's Telepathic Drawings
DESCRIPTION: A drawing duplication routine that uses ungimmicked clipboards to secretly get a peek.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: The performer brings forward two fairly large school slates, the same size, and gives one to a spectator.  The spectator is asked to draw a geometrical design on the slate with a piece of chalk.  The spectator is told to keep his drawing away from the view of the performer.  The performer places his slate up in front of, and square with, the spectators slate, thereby covering the drawing.  While the two slates are being held this way by the spectator, the mentalist draws a duplicate design on the outside of the top slate.  Upon separating the slates, the audience is shown that both drawings coincide

SUBJECT: Mind Reading Mysteries Vol 1
TITLE: Sterling-Tarbell Astrological Mindreading Act
DESCRIPTION: An incredibly clever method to obtain and reveal all kinds of information. This routine could be converted into an entire mind reading act.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: The performer passes out two slips of paper to members of the audience.  One slip is for the writing of the spectators month and day of birth, and the other slip bears an identifying number.  After the birthdates are written, the spectators are asked to fold their slips once in such a way that the writing is on the inside.  A manila envelope is shown to be empty.  The performer passes through the audience and collects the folded birthdate slips in the envelope.  After the slips are collected, the performer walks back to his table, empties the slips onto a plate, and sets them on fire.  While the slips are burning, the performer explains that the purpose of having the birthdates written was to impress the questions upon each persons mind.  The spectators are asked to take the slip containing their identifying number and fold it in half.  Again, the manila envelope is shown to be empty.  The performer collects the slips with the identifying numbers written on them.  The performer empties the slips from the envelope into another plate on the table.  The performer picks up a slip, reads the identifying number on it, and tells the person bearing that number when they were born, along with a few personal remarks about themselves.  This is continued until all of the birthdates have been revealed.

SUBJECT: Mind Reading Mysteries Vol 1
TITLE: Sydney Bergson's Thought Anticipation
DESCRIPTION: Impossibly divine a thought of listing from an ungimmicked book.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: A Thought Anticipation trick  where the audience writes down their thoughts on slips of paper and drop them into a box. The magician, in turn, writes a prediction on a slip of paper and places it in an envelope. Upon opening the envelope, the prediction matches one of the spectator's thoughts.

SUBJECT: Mind Reading Mysteries Vol 1
TITLE: Royal Message Reading
DESCRIPTION: A quick, easy way to glimpse written information trapped between two cards.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: A prediction trick  where the mentalist writes a prediction on a slip of paper and gives it to a spectator to hold. Several other slips of paper are given to the audience members, who are told to write down the name of a famous person and then seal their slips in envelopes. The magician then asks the spectator holding the prediction to open and read it. The prediction matches one of the names written down by the audience members.

SUBJECT: Mind Reading Mysteries Vol 1
TITLE: Sid Lorraine's Dictionary Message Reading
DESCRIPTION: A direct method to know any word chosen from a pocket dictionary.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: In this mentalist trick, the magician writes a prediction on a slip of paper.  The spectator tears out a page from a dictionary and circles a word, then adds other circled words to create a message. The message matches the magician's prediction.

SUBJECT: Mind Reading Mysteries Vol 1
TITLE: Tarbell "Wrapped Card" Message Reading
DESCRIPTION: You'll learn how to see what's written on a card completely wrapped in a piece of paper.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: In this trick, the magician writes a prediction on a card and places it in an envelope.  The spectator selects another card and seals it in the same envelope. Upon opening the envelope, the spectator's card has changed into the prediction card.

SUBJECT: Mind Reading Mysteries Vol 1
TITLE: Long Strip Billet Reading
DESCRIPTION: A variation to center tear a long strip of paper.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: A mind-reading trick  where the mentalist asks the audience to write down their thoughts or questions on a long strip of paper, which is then rolled up and secured with a rubber band. The magician takes the paper and, without opening it, reads the spectator's thoughts.

SUBJECT: Mind Reading Mysteries Vol 1
TITLE: Gerald Kosky's Prediction
DESCRIPTION: Add a number prediction using a post-it note pad.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: This mentalist trick involves a prediction and the audience's participation.  The magician brings out a large prediction and several small slips of paper for the audience to write on. The audience members are told to write down the names of famous people on the slips of paper. The magician then has the audience members select more slips of paper at random and write down the titles of songs. Another audience member is asked to select a name and a song at random, and these are found to match the magicians prediction.

SUBJECT: Mind Reading Mysteries Vol 2
TITLE: Parrish Mentalism
DESCRIPTION: A neat way to gain access to hidden information using only a book of paper matches.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: A mind-reading act  where the magician, blindfolded, reads messages written by the audience on slips of paper and dropped into a box. The magician then answers questions written on another slip of paper.

SUBJECT: Mind Reading Mysteries Vol 2
TITLE: Jack Avis' "Message from Hades"
DESCRIPTION: Predict any animal named in any color chosen.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: A mind-reading trick  where the magician asks a spectator to write down a question on a slip of paper and set it on fire. The ashes are then dropped into a bowl, and the magician, after gazing into the ashes, answers the question.

SUBJECT: Mind Reading Mysteries Vol 2
TITLE: Tarbell-Butler Envelope Prediction
DESCRIPTION: A prediction sealed inside two envelopes, contains all the information chosen by members of the audience.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: In this trick, the magician writes a prediction on a slip of paper, inserts it into an envelope, and gives it to a spectator to hold.  The audience then participates in a thought-of-card experiment, and the thought-of card matches the prediction in the envelope.

SUBJECT: Mind Reading Mysteries Vol 2
TITLE: Royal Newspaper Headline Prediction
DESCRIPTION: Predict a internet headline a week in advance.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: This newspaper trick involves a prediction and audience participation.  The magician writes a prediction on a slip of paper, which is then placed in an envelope. The audience members are asked to select a page from a newspaper, then select a word from that page. The magician then asks them to select more words to create a message. The message matches the prediction in the envelope.

SUBJECT: Mind Reading Mysteries Vol 2
TITLE: Tarbell-Parrish Newspaper Headline Prediction
DESCRIPTION: Predict a sensational headline created in-the-moment by members of the audience. Confabulation-style.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: This is a newspaper trick that involves a prediction and audience participation.  The magician writes a prediction on a slip of paper, which is then placed in an envelope. The audience members are asked to select a page from a newspaper, then select a word from that page. The magician then asks them to select more words to create a message. The message matches the prediction in the envelope.

SUBJECT: Mind Reading Mysteries Vol 2
TITLE: Celebrity Choice
DESCRIPTION: Your participant decides which photo to keep and you reveal it's the only famous autograph you have.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: This is a prediction trick where the magician writes a prediction on a card.  Several audience members are given blank cards, and one spectator is asked to select a celebrity's name from a list and write it on their card. The celebritys name matches the magicians prediction.

SUBJECT: Mind Reading Mysteries Vol 2
TITLE: How to Win Three Horse Races
DESCRIPTION: You predict three cards that will be chosen.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: This is a prediction trick where the magician writes a prediction on a card, which is then placed in an envelope.  Several audience members are given blank cards, and one spectator is asked to select three racehorses from a list and write them on their card. The horses' names match the magicians prediction.

SUBJECT: Mind Reading Mysteries Vol 2
TITLE: Spectator's Choice
DESCRIPTION: Your spectator finds three chosen cards.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: This is a prediction trick where the magician writes a prediction, which is then placed in an envelope.  Several audience members are given blank cards, and one spectator is asked to select three items from a list and write them on their card. The spectator's choices match the magicians prediction.

SUBJECT: Mind Reading Mysteries Vol 2
TITLE: Al Koran's "A Word in Thousands"
DESCRIPTION: Al Koran's book test masterpiece. Divine any word thought of from a book.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: A mind-reading trick where the magician asks a spectator to choose a word from a book. The spectator then chooses more words to make a message. The magician then reveals that he has anticipated the message.

SUBJECT: X-Ray Eyes and Blindfold Effects
TITLE: X-Ray Eyes
DESCRIPTION: The best-known method and presentation for the X-Ray Vision act in which the eyes are taped shut and covered with a thick cloth.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: This is a type of mind-reading trick where the magician, while blindfolded, can determine the color of a playing card, the time on a watch, and the value of a bill.

SUBJECT: X-Ray Eyes and Blindfold Effects
TITLE: A Simple Handkerchief Blindfold
DESCRIPTION: Learn how to make an effective blindfold from an ordinary bandana that easily switches from opaque to see-through whenever you desire.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: This is a simple and effective blindfold trick.  The magician is blindfolded with a handkerchief. Even though the magician is blindfolded, he can still perform various tasks, such as naming the color of a chosen card.

SUBJECT: X-Ray Eyes and Blindfold Effects
TITLE: The Modern Blindfold
DESCRIPTION: The same concept as the "Simple Handkerchief Blindfold", but applied to a professionally-made, innocent-looking strip of black cloth.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: This is a blindfold trick where the magician is blindfolded with a unique type of blindfold.  While blindfolded, the magician is able to perform various tasks, such as correctly identifying colors and performing other stunts, all while being guided by a spectator.

SUBJECT: X-Ray Eyes and Blindfold Effects
TITLE: The Blindfold Drive
DESCRIPTION: The classic publicity stunt of driving a car while blindfolded, performed live.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: This is a blindfold trick where the magician is blindfolded.  A spectator then guides the magician, who is still blindfolded, to a car. The spectator and the magician then go for a drive, and the magician, while still blindfolded, successfully drives the car.

SUBJECT: X-Ray Eyes and Blindfold Effects
TITLE: The Excelsior Hood Blindfold
DESCRIPTION: Learn how to make a black hood that can be examined by the audience, that covers your head completely, yet you can see right through it.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: This is a blindfold trick where the magician is blindfolded with a hood.  While blindfolded, the magician can perform various tasks or answer questions.

SUBJECT: X-Ray Eyes and Blindfold Effects
TITLE: The Velvetine Hood Blindfold
DESCRIPTION: A revised method allows you to see even with your eyes completely covered with tape, stuck down tightly on all edges.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: This is a blindfold trick where the magician is blindfolded with a hood. While blindfolded, the magician can perform various tasks or answer questions.

SUBJECT: X-Ray Eyes and Blindfold Effects
TITLE: Test-conditions Drawing Duplication
DESCRIPTION: Test-conditions Drawing Duplication: Harlan reveals his closely-guarded method that really does give you the super-power to see through opaque objects. You have to see it to believe it.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: This is a mind-reading trick where the magician asks a spectator to draw a series of symbols on a slip of paper.  The magician then duplicates the symbols.

SUBJECT: Silk and Rope Presentations
TITLE: Jimmy Herpick's Single Knot Release
DESCRIPTION: A full rope penetration act that plays BIG, using a necktie instead of a silk. You will learn various knot release techniques including: Jimmy Herpicks Single Knot Release, Lyons Handkerchief From Rope, Single Knot Handkerchief Through Rope, The Middleswart Handkerchief Knot, and the Tarbell-rice Dissolvo Handkerchief; As a bonus and kicker ending to the Five Piece Suit, you'll learn how to make the tie re-appear on your neck with Dan's practical, new design.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: This silk trick uses a single knot tied in a rope.  A silk is placed over the knot, and then the knot is visibly pulled right through the silk.

SUBJECT: Silk and Rope Presentations
TITLE: Lyon's Handkerchief from Rope
DESCRIPTION: A full rope penetration act that plays BIG, using a necktie instead of a silk. You will learn various knot release techniques including: Jimmy Herpicks Single Knot Release, Lyons Handkerchief From Rope, Single Knot Handkerchief Through Rope, The Middleswart Handkerchief Knot, and the Tarbell-rice Dissolvo Handkerchief; As a bonus and kicker ending to the Five Piece Suit, you'll learn how to make the tie re-appear on your neck with Dan's practical, new design.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: This silk trick uses a single knot tied in a rope.  A silk is placed over the knot, and then the knot is visibly pulled right through the silk.

SUBJECT: Silk and Rope Presentations
TITLE: Single Knot Handkerchief through Rope
DESCRIPTION: A full rope penetration act that plays BIG, using a necktie instead of a silk. You will learn various knot release techniques including: Jimmy Herpicks Single Knot Release, Lyons Handkerchief From Rope, Single Knot Handkerchief Through Rope, The Middleswart Handkerchief Knot, and the Tarbell-rice Dissolvo Handkerchief; As a bonus and kicker ending to the Five Piece Suit, you'll learn how to make the tie re-appear on your neck with Dan's practical, new design.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: This trick involves a knot tied in a rope and a silk handkerchief. The handkerchief is placed over the knot, and then the knot is visibly pulled right through the silk.

SUBJECT: Silk and Rope Presentations
TITLE: The Middleswart Handkerchief Knot
DESCRIPTION: A full rope penetration act that plays BIG, using a necktie instead of a silk. You will learn various knot release techniques including: Jimmy Herpicks Single Knot Release, Lyons Handkerchief From Rope, Single Knot Handkerchief Through Rope, The Middleswart Handkerchief Knot, and the Tarbell-rice Dissolvo Handkerchief; As a bonus and kicker ending to the Five Piece Suit, you'll learn how to make the tie re-appear on your neck with Dan's practical, new design.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: This rope trick involves a silk handkerchief tied with a knot around a rope.  The center of the handkerchief is then tied with a single knot around the rope. The ends of the handkerchief are then tied together with a square knot. Upon pulling on the handkerchief, it penetrates the rope.

SUBJECT: Silk and Rope Presentations
TITLE: Tarbell-rice Dissolvo Handkerchief Knot
DESCRIPTION: A full rope penetration act that plays BIG, using a necktie instead of a silk. You will learn various knot release techniques including: Jimmy Herpicks Single Knot Release, Lyons Handkerchief From Rope, Single Knot Handkerchief Through Rope, The Middleswart Handkerchief Knot, and the Tarbell-rice Dissolvo Handkerchief; As a bonus and kicker ending to the Five Piece Suit, you'll learn how to make the tie re-appear on your neck with Dan's practical, new design.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: This rope trick involves a silk handkerchief tied with a knot around a rope.  The ends of the handkerchief are then tied together with a square knot. Upon pulling on the handkerchief, it penetrates the rope.

SUBJECT: Silk and Rope Presentations
TITLE: Tarbell Triple Handkerchief Release
DESCRIPTION: Three handkerchiefs knotted together are used to perform an opening ceremony that gets your show off to a surprising start.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: This rope trick involves a silk handkerchief tied with a knot around a rope.  The ends of the handkerchief are then tied together with a square knot. Upon pulling on the handkerchief, it penetrates the rope.

SUBJECT: Silk and Rope Presentations
TITLE: Silk through the Wrist
DESCRIPTION: You will learn how to pass a silk scarf directly through your arm
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: A silk is tied around the performer's wrist with a piece of rope.  The performer then covers the rope and silk with a handkerchief. Upon removing the handkerchief, the silk is shown to be free of the rope.

SUBJECT: Escapes and Substitutions
TITLE: The Substitution Trunk Mystery
DESCRIPTION: Dan shows you the now-standard Substitution Trunk (or Metamorphosis), performed differently.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: A large trunk is shown empty.  The magicians assistant steps inside, and the trunk is closed and locked. A large cloth is then placed in front of the trunk, and a few moments later the assistant is found outside of the trunk. The trunk is opened, and it is shown to be empty.

SUBJECT: Escapes and Substitutions
TITLE: The Canvas Box Escape
DESCRIPTION: Dan transforms the substitution trunk into a modern, urban mystery with an instantaneous, and unexpected, exchange.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: A small canvas box is shown empty.  The magicians assistant steps inside, and the box is closed and locked. A large cloth is then placed in front of the box, and a few moments later the assistant is found outside of the box. The box is opened, and it is shown to be empty.

SUBJECT: Escapes and Substitutions
TITLE: The Royal Packing Box Escape
DESCRIPTION: You'll learn how to constuct a coffin escape complete with menacing spikes and a shocking ending.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: The magician's assistant steps into a packing box. The box is closed and locked, and then a large cloth is placed in front of the box. A few moments later, the assistant is found outside of the box. The box is opened, and it is shown to be empty.

SUBJECT: Escapes and Substitutions
TITLE: Grant's Packing Box Escape
DESCRIPTION: Easy to build and perform, this box can be inspected and signed by the whole audience, yet your escape takes only seconds.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: The magician's assistant steps into a packing box.  The box is closed and locked. A curtain is drawn, and a moment later the assistant is found outside of the box. The box is opened, and it is shown to be empty.

SUBJECT: Escapes and Substitutions
TITLE: Tarbell-Grant Packing Box Escape
DESCRIPTION: This seemingly straight-forward packing crate escape becomes a weird visible penetration effect explaining how the performer melts right through solid walls.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: The magician's assistant steps into a packing box.  The box is closed and locked. A curtain is drawn, and a moment later the assistant is found outside of the box. The box is opened, and it is shown to be empty.The magician's assistant steps into a packing box.  The box is closed and locked. A curtain is drawn, and a moment later the assistant is found outside of the box. The box is opened, and it is shown to be empty.

SUBJECT: Escapes and Substitutions
TITLE: Fischer-Bamberg Packing Box Escape
DESCRIPTION: You'll learn the clever secret of an innocent-looking box that still allows you to make a quick escape even though it's securely bound by ropes.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: The magician's assistant steps into a packing box. The box is closed and locked, and then a large cloth is placed in front of the box. A few moments later, the assistant is found outside of the box. The box is opened, and it is shown to be empty.

SUBJECT: Escapes and Substitutions
TITLE: The Paper Bag Escape
DESCRIPTION: An unusual escape, typically done with a paper bag, is updated to a large, clear, heavy-duty, plastic bag.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: The magician's assistant steps into a paper bag.  The bag is sealed with tape. A curtain is drawn, and a moment later the assistant is found outside of the bag. The bag is opened, and it is shown to be empty.

SUBJECT: Escapes and Substitutions
TITLE: The Bonbon Paper Bag Escape
DESCRIPTION: Dan's modern take on a silly idea becomes a wonderfully stunning showstopper. You'll learn to escape from two trash barrells locked together.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: The magician's assistant steps into a large paper bag. [cite: 308, 309] The bag is sealed with tape. A curtain is drawn, and a moment later the assistant is found outside of the bag. The bag is opened, and it is shown to be empty.

SUBJECT: Ball Tricks
TITLE: The Cups and Balls
DESCRIPTION: Impromptu cups and balls routine ending with tennis balls
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: Three opaque cups are shown upside down on a table. Three balls are also displayed and placed under the cups. The balls then mysteriously vanish and reappear under the cups, despite the magician never seeming to lift the cups.

SUBJECT: Ball Tricks
TITLE: The Three Wandering Sponge Balls
DESCRIPTION: Sponge ball routine utilizing 4 sponge balls (comedy)
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: standard sponge ball routine

SUBJECT: Ball Tricks
TITLE: The Four Traveling Balls
DESCRIPTION: Sponge ball routine where 3 balls teleport to under a hat one by one while the spectator is watching the hat.  The finale is a giant load.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: sponge ball routine with hat

SUBJECT: Ball Tricks
TITLE: The Patriotic Paper Balls
DESCRIPTION: 3 packets of ketchup are placed into spectator 1s paper bag, 3 packets of mustard are placed into spectator 2s paper bag. 3 packets of relish are placed into spectator 3s paper bag. magician snaps. All 3 spectators now have 1 of each condiment.  When magician tears open all bags, giant squeaky hot dog appears.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: Three bowls and red, white, and blue balls.

SUBJECT: Spirit Ties and Vest Turning
TITLE: Gysel's Spirit Tie
DESCRIPTION: You'll learn how to be tied to a chair, yet still be able to move your arms freely. This method is used in Harlans updated spirit cabinet routine. You'll see how to make objects move or appear from nowhere with just a brief plunge into darkness
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: The magician exhibits a large foulard and a cord, with the ends of the cord tied together to form a loop. The magician places the foulard through the cord loop and holds the foulard and cord in front of a spectator. The spectator then ties a knot in the foulard. The magician takes hold of the foulard and visibly pulls it free from the cord.

SUBJECT: Spirit Ties and Vest Turning
TITLE: The Marvel Wrist Tie
DESCRIPTION: A convincing wrist tie that seems impossible to beat, but you can make your escape in mere seconds
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: The magician has his wrists tied together with a piece of rope.  The magicians assistant then covers the magicians hands with a handkerchief. When the handkerchief is removed, the rope is shown to be tied around the magicians waist.

SUBJECT: Spirit Ties and Vest Turning
TITLE: The Kellar Rope Tie
DESCRIPTION: With your hands securly tied behind your back, you are able to quickly remove your hand from, and replace your hand back in the tie. The infamous Kellar rope tie retains all the mystery of the original with quite a few extra weird moments thrown in.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: The magician has his wrists tied together with a piece of rope.  The magicians assistant then covers the magicians hands with a cloth. When the cloth is removed, the rope is shown to be tied around the magicians neck.

SUBJECT: Spirit Ties and Vest Turning
TITLE: Vest Turning
DESCRIPTION: Re-imagined as a crazy party stunt where you turn your volunteer's T-shirt inside out while he's securely tied.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: The magician is shown wearing a vest.  The vest is then covered with a large cloth, and a moment later the vest is found to be turned inside out.

SUBJECT: Modern Stage Magic
TITLE: Fu Manchu's Magic Microphone
DESCRIPTION: Youll learn how to make a microphone that can be opened up, shown empty, and then used to produce various small objects. Comes complete with a full smooth jazz routine
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: A stage microphone is shown and then covered with a red silk.  Upon removing the silk, the microphone has changed into a bouquet of spring flowers.

SUBJECT: Modern Stage Magic
TITLE: Chinese Tape through the Neck
DESCRIPTION: A convincing penetration through the neck that can be performed with a scarf, ribbon, rope, or tie. Improved with a little twist.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: A stage trick  where the magicians assistant is on stage, and the magician shows a long piece of white tape and wraps it around the assistants neck. Upon unwrapping the tape, the assistant is unharmed.

SUBJECT: Modern Stage Magic
TITLE: Berland's Tray Servante
DESCRIPTION: An easy to make utility device that turns any tray into a versatile, secret servante.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: A tray, seemingly normal, is shown. It is then covered with a cloth, and upon removing the cloth, a large stack of sandwiches is found on the tray.

SUBJECT: Modern Stage Magic
TITLE: Judge Wethered's Black Art Tray
DESCRIPTION: A utility table that allows you to make just about anything appear or vanish without sleight-of-hand. Comes complete with a cups and balls beer pong routine.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: A tray is shown and then covered with a black cloth.  Upon removing the cloth, several articles are found on the tray.

SUBJECT: Modern Stage Magic
TITLE: The Hindu Turban Mystery
DESCRIPTION: The classic cut-and-restored rope gets a stage-size upgrade to play to a much bigger crowd.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: This is a stage trick where the magician's assistant, wearing a turban, is on stage. The magician fires a gun, and the assistant's turban is instantly unwound.

SUBJECT: Modern Stage Magic
TITLE: Don Greenwood's Lighted Cigarette Routine
DESCRIPTION: A full cigarette manipulation routine with a big ending. You'll learn how to make the craziest smoking jacket you have ever seen.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: This is a cigarette trick that begins with the magician showing a small metal tube.  Upon blowing into the tube, a lit cigarette emerges.

SUBJECT: Modern Stage Magic
TITLE: Jack Chanin's Cigarette Routine
DESCRIPTION: The cigarettes here are replaced with french fries to have a little fun with some fast food, finally ending up with a fresh vegetable snack.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: This is a cigarette trick where the magicians assistant places a cigarette in the magicians mouth.  The magician then lights a match, but the match mysteriously extinguishes itself. The magician then snaps his fingers, and the cigarette is shown to be lit.

SUBJECT: Modern Stage Magic
TITLE: George Sands' Cigarette Production
DESCRIPTION: You'll learn all about the challenges of shooting magic underwater as a somewhat standard cigarette routine gets a completely surreal re-working.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: This is a cigarette trick where the magician shows a tin pan and a metal tube.  The magician places the tube in the pan, and a lit cigarette emerges.

SUBJECT: Modern Stage Magic
TITLE: Jimmy Herpick's Cigarette Routine
DESCRIPTION: The cigarettes here are replaced with crayons to show you how the same techniques work just as well, including the final production of a jumbo sharpie
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: This is a cigarette trick where the magician produces four lit cigarettes from a cigarette case.

SUBJECT: Modern Stage Magic
TITLE: George Sands' "Phantom" Cigarette
DESCRIPTION: You'll learn how to roll an invisible cigarette and make it impossibly appear in front of your audience.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: This is a cigarette trick where the magician lights a cigarette and places it in his left hand.  The magician then closes his hand into a fist, and a moment later the cigarette has vanished.

SUBJECT: Modern Stage Magic
TITLE: David Tobias Bamberg's Coin in Ball of Wool
DESCRIPTION: A signed coin vanishes and ends up inside the center of a ball of yarn.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: This is a coin trick where the magician shows a ball of yarn and a coin.  The magician then places the coin in his mouth and gives the ball of yarn to a spectator to hold. The magician then takes the ball of yarn back from the spectator and pulls out the coin from the center of the ball.

SUBJECT: Modern Stage Magic
TITLE: David Tobias Bamberg's Ring in Ball of Wool
DESCRIPTION: A borrowed ring vanishes and ends up inside the center of a ball of yarn.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: This is a ring trick where the magician shows a ball of yarn and a ring. The magician then has a spectator select a card from a deck of cards. The magician then places the ring in his mouth and gives the ball of yarn to another spectator to hold. The magician then takes the ball of yarn back from the spectator and pulls out the ring from the center of the ball. The magician then reveals that the card that the spectator selected earlier matches the box that the ball of yarn came in.

SUBJECT: Modern Stage Magic
TITLE: Ed Reno's Knife through the Arm
DESCRIPTION: You will learn how to plunge a pair of scissors right through your palm.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: This is a stage trick where the magician has a spectator come up on stage and place their arm through a hole in a board.  The magician then takes a large knife and seemingly penetrates the spectators arm with the knife. Upon removing the knife, the spectators arm is unharmed.

SUBJECT: Stage Productions
TITLE: UF Grant's Carton Production
DESCRIPTION: You will learn how to make an innocent-looking cardboard box that can be shown completely empty, yet allows you to produce just about anything you want.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: The magician shows a square box to be empty. [cite: 367, 368, 369] The magician then reaches into the box and produces a bottle of champagne and several glasses.

SUBJECT: Stage Productions
TITLE: The Square and Circle Production
DESCRIPTION: Two routines using the versatile Square and Circle production box. Produce anything you want on stage. When you really want to go big on a budget, you can't do much better than this.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: The magician shows a box with a hole in the top and another hole in the side.  The magician places his arm through the hole in the side of the box, and then reaches into the box through the hole in the top. Upon removing his hand, a production is made.

SUBJECT: Stage Productions
TITLE: Vincent Malmstrom's Organ Pipe Routine
DESCRIPTION: Three tubes are shown empty yet produce a bountiful banquet of food and beverages sure to impress all your guests.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: This is a production routine that uses four brightly colored organ pipes.  The magician and assistant show the organ pipes, which are then placed behind a screen. Upon removing the screen, the four organ pipes have become a variety of other objects.

SUBJECT: Stage Productions
TITLE: The Doll House Illusion
DESCRIPTION: A brand new design for the infamous Doll House illusion allowing the entire interior to be displayed.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: This is a stage illusion where a large doll house is shown on stage with a spectator inside.  The doll house has open windows and a door. A curtain is drawn in front of the doll house, and a moment later the spectator has vanished.

SUBJECT: Stage Productions
TITLE: Christopher's Slot Machine Illusion
DESCRIPTION: Produce a Las Vegas Showgirl from an antique slot machine.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: This is a stage illusion where a slot machine is shown on stage.  Three spectators select three different numbers, and the magicians assistant enters the slot machine. The magician then pulls the lever, and the slot machine displays the three numbers that were selected.

SUBJECT: Magic as Theater
TITLE: Thesis
DESCRIPTION: Elements of Theater- Stage Types- Stage Directions- Props- Costumes- Lighting- The Stanislawski Method- Scripting- The Six Functions of Dialogue- Practice and Rehearsal
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: The thesis in "Magic as Theatre" is that magic, like any good theatre, should be presented in a way that engages the audience and evokes a sense of wonder, not merely as a display of skill or cleverness.  This involves using clear, evocative language, a calm and sincere demeanor, and a focus on the dramatic elements of the performance to create a more immersive and impactful experience for the audience.  The goal is to make the audience feel like they are experiencing something truly magical, rather than simply witnessing a clever trick.
