SUBJECT: More Mental Magic
TITLE: The Telepathic Pillboxes
DESCRIPTION: A simple choice of one of three cartoon characters decorating three nesting boxes and you're able to reveal you knew which one someone would choose.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: The magician displays two pillboxes, one containing a white pill and the other containing a black pill. A spectator is asked to choose one of the pills and place it in their hand. The magician then divines the color of the pill.

SUBJECT: More Mental Magic
TITLE: Pavel's Predicta-Rope
DESCRIPTION: Your helper passes a psychic test by tying three ropes together in any order. The ropes are then proven to match your prediction
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: The magician displays a length of rope and has it examined by the audience. The rope is then cut into three pieces. The magician then ties the three pieces together, and the rope is restored.

SUBJECT: More Mental Magic
TITLE: Bergson's Non-Center Tear
DESCRIPTION: A simple, innocent-looking substitute for a center tear or fancy peek device giving you total access to hidden information.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: The magician writes a prediction on a piece of paper, which is then folded and placed aside. A spectator is asked to select a page from a book and concentrate on a word on that page. The magician then tears a page from the same book and writes something on it. The magician's writing is shown to match the spectator's selected word.

SUBJECT: More Mental Magic
TITLE: Spirit Transposition
DESCRIPTION: You will learn to gain access to hidden information, not just mentally, but physically as well, without any gimmicks or extraneous devices.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: Two handkerchiefs are tied together and then mysteriously transpose places.

SUBJECT: More Mental Magic
TITLE: Overdrawn
DESCRIPTION: A fun routine where you can always tell how many cookies somebody has removed from the cookie jar.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: A mind-reading trick where the magician correctly predicts the amount of money that will be in a spectator's possession.

SUBJECT: More Mental Magic
TITLE: Louis Philip's Calcutta
DESCRIPTION: You will learn how to reveal any city chosen from a large selection.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: The magician is shown wearing a vest. The vest is then covered with a large cloth, and a moment later the vest is found to be turned inside out.

SUBJECT: More Mental Magic
TITLE: Addition Prediction
DESCRIPTION: Using UNO cards, you predict the sum of a 5 player game.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: The magician writes a prediction on a piece of paper, which is then folded and placed aside. A spectator is asked to select a page from a book and concentrate on a word on that page. The magician then tears a page from the same book and writes something on it. The magician's writing is shown to match the spectator's selected word.

SUBJECT: More Mental Magic
TITLE: Ed Schuman's Sightless Sight
DESCRIPTION: A little-known and under-used principle, you'll learn to find hidden treasure written on a card, and reveal it without looking.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: This is a type of mind-reading trick where the magician, while blindfolded, can determine the color of a playing card, the time on a watch, and the value of a bill.

SUBJECT: More Mental Magic
TITLE: Ken Beale's Triple ESP Prediction
DESCRIPTION: Three alphabet cards, chosen by a random number, spell a word... and you reveal the physical manifestation of that word.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: In this mentalist trick, three spectators are each given a card and a small board.  They are asked to draw an ESP symbol on the card. The magician then makes a prediction on a large board, and the prediction matches one of the spectator's symbols.

SUBJECT: More Mental Magic
TITLE: You Read my Mind
DESCRIPTION: Your helpers somehow name the face-up suit among four cards hidden in an envelope.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: This is a mind-reading trick where the magician correctly predicts a word that a spectator is thinking of.

SUBJECT: More Mental Magic
TITLE: Ken Krenzel's Never Say Die
DESCRIPTION: A die (rolled randomly) matches the number in another person's mind.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: This is a stage trick where the magician has his wrists tied together with a piece of rope.  The magicians assistant then covers the magicians hands with a cloth. When the cloth is removed, the rope is shown to be tied around the magicians neck.

SUBJECT: More Mental Magic
TITLE: Mento-Pen
DESCRIPTION: A sneaky technique combined with a bit of flair allows you to know what snack someone will choose to have in her lunchbag.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: A small, folded piece of paper is shown and then placed in a glass.  A fountain pen is also shown. The pen is then placed in the glass, and the glass is covered with a handkerchief. Upon removing the handkerchief, the paper is found to be unfolded.

SUBJECT: More Mental Magic
TITLE: A Spectator Reads a Mind
DESCRIPTION: You can give someone the power to see a thought-of card in a borrowed ring.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: A spectator writes a message on a piece of paper, which is then folded and placed aside. The spectator then concentrates on the message, and the magician reveals the message.

SUBJECT: More Mental Magic
TITLE: The Antique Medallion
DESCRIPTION: A spectator names an imaginary animal. That name is then found engraved on the collar of a stuffed animal.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: This is a medallion effect where a gold medallion with a red ribbon attached is placed in a small box.  The magician then covers the box with a foulard, and a moment later the medallion is found to be outside of the box, with the ribbon tied in a knot.

SUBJECT: More Mental Magic
TITLE: Classified Ad Prediction
DESCRIPTION: Predict the exact make, model, and year of a randomly predicted used car.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: In this mentalist trick, the magician writes a prediction on a slip of paper.  A spectator is asked to choose a classified ad from a newspaper. The magician then asks the spectator to select more words from the classified section to make a message. The message matches the magicians prediction.

SUBJECT: More Mental Magic
TITLE: Max Lister's Easy Message Reading
DESCRIPTION: A clever method that allows you to actually read a message truly sealed in an envelope and destroyed by fire.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: In this mentalist trick, the magician displays a large board with 100 different words on it.  The magician then writes a prediction on a slip of paper, which is placed in an envelope. A spectator is asked to select a word from the board, and then select more words to make a message. The message matches the magicians prediction.

SUBJECT: Card Magic Vol 1
TITLE: Fred Lowe's Card in Glass
DESCRIPTION: Reveal a chosen card by having it appear inside a mason jar while covered by a handkerchief.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: A card is selected, returned to the deck, and the deck is shuffled. The magician then throws the cards into a glass. All of the cards miss the glass and fall on the floor except for the selected card, which lands in the glass.

SUBJECT: Card Magic Vol 1
TITLE: Audley Walsh's Three Card Monte
DESCRIPTION: A handy little convincer you can add to any three card monte routine allowing you to mark the money card yet still get away with the swindle.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: Three cards are shown, and a spectator is asked to follow one of the cards. The cards are then turned over, and the spectator is unable to identify the chosen card.

SUBJECT: Card Magic Vol 1
TITLE: Barry Stevenson's Card in Wallet
DESCRIPTION: A selected card appears in a previously examined empty envelope held by the spectator.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: A card is selected, returned to the deck, and the deck is shuffled. The magician then places the deck in his pocket. A spectator is asked to name their card, and the magician reaches into his pocket and removes the selected card from his wallet.

SUBJECT: Card Magic Vol 1
TITLE: Bob Gunther's Repeat Card to Wallet
DESCRIPTION: A no-palm card to wallet, instantly repeatable with no reset.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: A card is selected, returned to the deck, and the deck is shuffled. The magician then places the deck in his pocket. A spectator is asked to name their card, and the magician reaches into his pocket and removes the selected card from his wallet. The magician then repeats the trick, with the same card being selected and found in the wallet.

SUBJECT: Card Magic Vol 1
TITLE: Eric Peterson's Card Prediction
DESCRIPTION: A stand-up piece where your helper magically matches three hidden cards in increasingly impossible ways.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: The magician correctly predicts three cards selected by a spectator.

SUBJECT: Card Magic Vol 1
TITLE: Mel Jones' Shower of Cards
DESCRIPTION: You'll learn how to catch a chosen card out of a flutter of falling cards using two different methods.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: The magician throws a deck of cards into the air, and a spectator is able to catch a chosen card out of the shower of falling cards.

SUBJECT: Card Magic Vol 1
TITLE: Ludor Fiedler's Sure-Fire Force
DESCRIPTION: A wonderfully clever method that takes care of both forcing and vanishing a card, which you can make reappear wherever you want.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: A card force where the magician forces a specific card on a spectator.

SUBJECT: Card Magic Vol 1
TITLE: X Equals Five
DESCRIPTION: An incredible paper-folding playing card revelation.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: A prediction trick where the magician writes a prediction on a piece of paper, which is then folded and placed aside. A spectator is asked to select a page from a book and concentrate on a word on that page. The magician then tears a page from the same book and writes something on it. The magician's writing is shown to match the spectator's selected word.

SUBJECT: Card Magic Vol 1
TITLE: Die-Duction
DESCRIPTION: Know a card at any number rolled by 3 dice.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: The magician correctly predicts the total of a spectator's dice rolls.

SUBJECT: Card Magic Vol 1
TITLE: Mental Thought Pin-Up Girls
DESCRIPTION: Print your own business cards with your bare hands.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: The magician displays a board with several pin-up girls. [cite: 466, 467, 468] A spectator is asked to select a pin-up girl and concentrate on her. The magician then reveals the pin-up girl that the spectator was thinking of.

SUBJECT: Card Magic Vol 1
TITLE: Oriental "Decoder" Prediction
DESCRIPTION: How to decode strange alien messages.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: The magician presents a small, ornately decorated box and writes a prediction on a piece of paper, which is then placed aside. A spectator is invited to examine the box and finds a set of five colored stones inside. The spectator then selects one of the stones and places it in their pocket. The magician then opens the box and reveals that the remaining stones form a message that matches the prediction.

SUBJECT: Card Magic Vol 1
TITLE: Orville Meyer's Miniscape
DESCRIPTION: A mini card escapes from inside a lamination.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: The magician displays a miniature stage setting and places it on a table. [cite: 472, 473, 474] A small doll is then placed on the stage. The magician covers the stage with a cloth, and a moment later the doll is found to have vanished.

SUBJECT: Card Magic Vol 1
TITLE: The Baxter-Lorayne Wrap-Around Reverse
DESCRIPTION: How to reverse a chosen card in a deck placed out of reach on the table.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: A card is selected, returned to the deck, and the deck is shuffled. The magician then wraps the deck in a piece of paper. The spectator is asked to name their card, and the magician tears open the paper. The selected card is found to be reversed in the deck.

SUBJECT: Card Magic Vol 1
TITLE: Bob Baxter's Rising and Vanishing Card
DESCRIPTION: Make any card rise out of the deck while covered, and eventually vanish completely.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: A card is selected and returned to the deck. The deck is placed in a glass. The spectator's card rises from the deck, and then vanishes.

SUBJECT: Card Magic Vol 2
TITLE: Irving Berk's Card-Forcing Box
DESCRIPTION: Learn how to make a ungimmicked box that will force a card (or cards) or make a signed selection come to the top all while the deck is isolated inside.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: A card is selected and returned to the deck. The deck is placed in a box, and the spectator is asked to name their card. The box is opened, and the selected card is found to be the only card in the box.

SUBJECT: Card Magic Vol 2
TITLE: Alan Alan's Rising Card
DESCRIPTION: A cool gadget you can build and wear that allows you to make a card rise from an ordinary deck.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: A card is selected and returned to the deck. The deck is placed in a glass. The spectator's card rises from the deck.

SUBJECT: Card Magic Vol 2
TITLE: The Mesmerized Cards
DESCRIPTION: Learn how to make cards magnetically cling to your palm.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: The magician displays a fan of cards, and the spectator selects one. The card is then placed back into the deck, and the deck is shuffled. The magician then shows the cards one by one, and the spectator's card is found to be reversed in the deck.

SUBJECT: Card Magic Vol 2
TITLE: Bet-A-Dollar Color Change
DESCRIPTION: A nice and easy color-change that uses a bill and requires no sleight-of-hand.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: The magician holds a playing card face up in one hand. The magician then waves their other hand over the card, and the card visibly changes color.

SUBJECT: Card Magic Vol 2
TITLE: Topsy-Turvy Follow Me
DESCRIPTION: A follow-the-leader-style packet trick which allows everyone to find their own cards.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: Two cards are selected and placed face up in the deck. The deck is then shuffled, and the two cards are found to have turned face down. The deck is shuffled again, and the two cards are found to have turned face up again.

SUBJECT: Card Magic Vol 2
TITLE: Tony Noice's Card Transposition
DESCRIPTION: If sleight-of-hand is your thing, you'll have some fun with this quick transposition sequence.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: Two cards are selected and placed face up in the deck. The deck is then shuffled, and the two cards are found to have changed places.

SUBJECT: Card Magic Vol 2
TITLE: Rising Cards from Envelope
DESCRIPTION: Using only a couple of common office supplies, you can perform a nifty rising card routine where everything ends clean.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: The magician displays an envelope and a deck of cards. The deck is shuffled, and a spectator selects a card. The card is signed and returned to the deck. The deck is then placed in the envelope. The magician then causes several cards to rise from the envelope, one at a time. The last card to rise is the spectator's signed card.

SUBJECT: Card Magic Vol 2
TITLE: Seeing through the Deck
DESCRIPTION: A strange (nearly self-working) way to pinpoint a selected card.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: The magician appears to have the ability to see through a deck of cards, identifying a spectator's chosen card.

SUBJECT: Card Magic Vol 2
TITLE: Two Hindu Shuffle Forces of More than One Card
DESCRIPTION: A number of ways to force, glimpse, and control cards with the Hindu Shuffle.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: The magician shuffles a deck of cards using a Hindu Shuffle. The spectator is asked to call out "stop" at any point during the shuffle. The magician then shows the card that is at the bottom of the cut-off portion of the deck. 1  This is repeated several times, with the spectator selecting a different card each time.

SUBJECT: Card Magic Vol 2
TITLE: The Boston-Lorayne Card Change
DESCRIPTION: A pretty color-change using a fan of cards.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: The magician holds a playing card face up in one hand. The magician then waves their other hand over the card, and the card visibly changes to a different card.

SUBJECT: Card Magic Vol 2
TITLE: Stripper Spin Reverse
DESCRIPTION: Super-slick method to gain control over multiple cards using a mixture of sleight-of-hand and a common gimmicked deck.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: The magician holds a playing card face up in one hand. The magician then causes the card to visibly spin around and change to a different card.

SUBJECT: Card Magic Vol 2
TITLE: The Non Telephone Telephone Trick
DESCRIPTION: Magic mixed with a bit of math used to find multiple cards in a random process.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: The magician displays a telephone on stage. The magician then proceeds to make a telephone call without dialing a number. The magician then has a conversation with the person on the other end of the line.

SUBJECT: Card Magic Vol 2
TITLE: A Red and Black Separation
DESCRIPTION: You'll learn how to get the red and black cards to instantly separate even though you've mixed them together face-up.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: A deck of cards is shown, and the red and black cards are separated. The magician then shuffles the deck, and the cards are still separated by color.

SUBJECT: Rope Magic
TITLE: Tarbell's Chinese Rope Chain
DESCRIPTION: A piece of rope tied into a chain of loops is cut into many short pieces and then magically restored.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: The magician displays a rope, which is then formed into a loop. The magician then causes the rope to visibly link and unlink itself.

SUBJECT: Rope Magic
TITLE: The Many-Cut Rope Mystery
DESCRIPTION: Repeatedly cut a long rope into a bunch of tiny pieces, and restore it.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: The magician displays a rope, which is then cut into several pieces. The magician then ties the pieces together, and the rope is restored.

SUBJECT: Rope Magic
TITLE: Tarbell's Sympathetic Ropes
DESCRIPTION: Tie a knot in one rope and a knot appears in the other. Untie the knot, and it's gone from the other. You can even cut one and the other one will also, magically, be cut.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: The magician displays two ropes, one of which is tied into a loop. The magician then causes the two ropes to link and unlink themselves.

SUBJECT: Rope Magic
TITLE: Tarbell's Zip-Over Rope Mystery
DESCRIPTION: Learn a way to steal the knots right off the center of another piece of rope.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: The magician displays a rope, which is then tied into a loop. The magician then causes the rope to visibly jump from one hand to the other.

SUBJECT: Rope Magic
TITLE: Crocheting with your Teeth
DESCRIPTION: Restore a cut string by weaving the ends together in your mouth.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: The magician displays a crochet hook and a ball of yarn. The magician then proceeds to crochet a chain stitch using only their teeth.

SUBJECT: Rope Magic
TITLE: Borrowed Ring on Loop of String
DESCRIPTION: A sneaky wager with a silly solution becomes a real mystery as a knot visibly melts back into a piece of rope.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: A ring is borrowed from a spectator and then threaded onto a loop of string. The ring is then visibly pulled free from the string.

SUBJECT: Novelty Magic Vol 1
TITLE: Borrowed Ring in Box

SUBJECT: Mysteries of the Seance
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: The historical intersection of spiritualism and magic. It explains how magicians often used tricks and illusions to create "supernatural" effects, capitalizing on the public's fascination with the occult. Some magicians even blurred the lines between entertainment and deception, leading people to believe they had genuine mediumistic powers. The article concludes by emphasizing the ethical difference between fraudulent mediums and magicians who use their skills for entertainment purposes.

The magician seemingly pours wine and water into the glasses, mixes them in various ways, then pours them back into the pitcher. Despite the apparent mixing of liquids, the pitcher remains filled with clear water. Finally, the magician pours water from the pitcher into a fifth glass, which inexplicably turns into milk.

SUBJECT: Further Unique Mysteries Part 1
TITLE: Tarbell's Anytime Cake in Hat
DESCRIPTION: You will learn how to cook a magical birthday cake in a borrowed hat. A complete routine that is great for birthday parties.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: The magician borrows a hat from the audience. After showing it to be empty, he somehow bakes a cake inside the hat. This trick is suitable for birthday parties.

SUBJECT: Further Unique Mysteries Part 1
TITLE: The Enchanted Cane
DESCRIPTION: An umbrella floats and defies gravity at your command. It's an updated version of the floating cane to tell a rainy-day story with an elusive umbrella.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: A cane appears to move and float without support. The magician uses a hidden thread to control the cane, creating the illusion of magical magnetism and levitation.

SUBJECT: Further Unique Mysteries Part 1
TITLE: The LW Bewitched Handkerchief and Glass
DESCRIPTION: A funny, interactive spectator-as-magician trick with a surprise vanish of a glass and its eventual return with a teleporting silk handkerchief.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: A handkerchief vanishes from the magician's hand and reappears inside a glass that's been covered with a handkerchief.

SUBJECT: Further Unique Mysteries Part 1
TITLE: A Topsy-Turvy Word
DESCRIPTION: You'll learn some special words that won't reflect in a mirror and how to use them to discover which one your helper has chosen.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: A pack of Camel cigarettes is shown with the words "CHOICE QUALITY" printed on the side. When the pack is held up to a mirror, the words appear reversed, as expected. However, upon removing the pack from the mirror, the words remain reversed. Then, when shown in the mirror again, "CHOICE" appears normal while "QUALITY" is upside down. Finally, the pack is removed from the mirror again, and both words are inexplicably right side up once more.

SUBJECT: Further Unique Mysteries Part 1
TITLE: The Mysterious Cross
DESCRIPTION: A penetration effect of ashes through the flesh and bone of your hand, appearing on the other side.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: A magician draws a cross on their palm with a burnt match. They then draw a smaller mark on the back of the same hand and rub it off. When the hand is turned over, the small mark has seemingly passed through the hand and joined the cross on the palm.

SUBJECT: Further Unique Mysteries Part 1
TITLE: Solid through Solid String
DESCRIPTION: A quick penetration using some common objects you'll likely find at any well-stocked bar.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: A piece of candy is threaded onto a string and the ends of the string are given to a spectator to hold. The candy is covered with a handkerchief, and when it is uncovered, the candy has been removed from the string.

SUBJECT: Further Unique Mysteries Part 1
TITLE: Come-Back Bread Crumb
DESCRIPTION: The classic two-in-the-hand, one-in-the-pocket gets a brand new treatment and a super-sweet new ending.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: The magician shows three small balls of bread.  Two of the balls are placed, one at a time, into the magicians left hand.  The third ball is thrown away.  When the magician opens their left hand, there are three balls of bread.

SUBJECT: Further Unique Mysteries Part 2
TITLE: The Cloudburst Coin
DESCRIPTION: Squeeze water from a borrowed coin, then transform the coin into tons more!
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: The magician borrows a coin and displays it on both sides.  The magician shows their hands empty, then holds the coin between their thumb and forefingers.  Water flows from the coin.  The magician again shows their hands empty, and returns the coin.

SUBJECT: Further Unique Mysteries Part 2
TITLE: Tarbell's Production Hat
DESCRIPTION: Learn how to construct and use a simple, versatile top hat which appears empty, but secretly contains whatever you want.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: A top hat is shown empty.  A rabbit is produced from the hat OR A top hat is shown empty.  Several eggs are produced from the hat.

SUBJECT: Further Unique Mysteries Part 2
TITLE: A Derby and Silk Routine
DESCRIPTION: A patriotic themed silk routine with a large flag production.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: An empty hat sits on a table.  A red, white, and green silk are shown.  The red and green silks are tied together and dropped into the hat.  The white silk vanishes, and is found tied between the red and green silks in the hat.  The silks are untied.  All three silks vanish again, and are found back in the hat.

SUBJECT: Further Unique Mysteries Part 2
TITLE: Tarbell's Potato and Die
DESCRIPTION: Learn how to make a Rubik's cube, held by your spectator, change places instantly with a rubber band ball.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: A large die and a potato are shown.  The potato is placed in a hat, and a plate is placed over the opening of the hat.  The die is placed on the plate, and is covered.  When the die is uncovered, the potato has taken its place.  The die is found inside the hat.

SUBJECT: Further Unique Mysteries Part 2
TITLE: Tarbell's First Torn Paper Routine
DESCRIPTION: A practical method for the torn and restored cigarette paper.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: A tissue paper square is displayed on both sides, and the hands are shown otherwise empty.  The tissue is torn into nine pieces and crumpled into a ball.  When the tissue ball is opened, the pieces are seen to be completely restored.

SUBJECT: Further Unique Mysteries Part 2
TITLE: Tarbell's Oranges
DESCRIPTION: Over-sized version of the cups and balls using flower pots and eggs, ending with the most beautiful spring flowers you've ever seen. Harlan will teach you everything you need to make them at home.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: The magician has three oranges and a knife.  The oranges are thrown one at a time into a hat.  The knife is then stuck into the hat.  When the hat is overturned, the three oranges have become one.

SUBJECT: Further Unique Mysteries Part 2
TITLE: Classic Water Bowl Production
DESCRIPTION: Learn how to produce a bowl of cereal from a large cloth. A perfect opener.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: A large bowl is shown to be empty and filled with water. The water is poured from the bowl, and the bowl is shown empty again. The bowl is covered with a cloth, and a variety of different flowers are produced from the bowl. The bowl is again shown empty.

SUBJECT: Magic with Cards
TITLE: Slippery Aces
DESCRIPTION: A classic ace assembly using a simple sleight that lets you vanish the aces in a unique way.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: The four aces are placed into the center of the deck.  The deck is then cut and the top card of the lower packet is shown.  The top card of the upper packet is also shown.  Neither card is an ace.  When the deck is turned over, the two cards have become the aces of spades and hearts.  The deck is then turned face down again, the cards are placed into the center of the deck, and the deck is again cut.  The top cards of the upper and lower packets are again shown.  Again, neither card is an ace.  When the deck is turned over, the two cards have become the aces of diamonds and clubs.

SUBJECT: Magic with Cards
TITLE: The Mystic Aces
DESCRIPTION: Another ace assembly involving a subtle, and highly-deceptive technique allowing you to track the aces
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: The four aces are removed from the deck and placed face up in a row on the table. One ace is turned face down. The aces are gathered and placed face down in a row on the table. When the aces are turned face up, two aces have changed places. The aces are again gathered and placed face down in a row on the table. When the aces are turned face up, all four aces are face up.

SUBJECT: Magic with Cards
TITLE: The Kick-Back Card Discovery
DESCRIPTION: A quick, simple, somewhat flourishy discovery of a card.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: A card is selected and returned to the deck.  The deck is then shuffled and placed into the left hand.  The right hand slaps the deck, and one card is kicked back into the right hand.  The card is shown to be the selected card.

SUBJECT: Magic with Cards
TITLE: A Good Card Trick
DESCRIPTION: Another fun way to find a selected card.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: A deck of cards is shuffled and placed on the table face down. A spectator is requested to cut the cards and to note the card at the point of cutting. The card is returned to the deck and the cards are cut a number of times. The cards are dealt onto the table face down and the performer has no difficulty locating the selected card.

SUBJECT: Magic with Cards
TITLE: Rising Cards from Envelope Method 1
DESCRIPTION: Multiple methods for making selected cards rise from an envelope.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: The court cards are separated from the deck. Three spectators each select a card. The three cards are replaced among the other court cards and shuffled by another spectator. An envelope is shown empty. Into it the twelve court cards are inserted and the flap of the envelope turned down over all and sealed tight. At the magicians command the three selected cards rise one at a time, apparently through the envelope.

SUBJECT: Magic with Cards
TITLE: Rising Cards from Envelope Method 2
DESCRIPTION: Multiple methods for making selected cards rise from an envelope.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: Three cards are freely selected from a dozen cards by members of the audience. The cards are returned and placed into an envelope which has been sealed and one end cut off. The three selected cards rise from the envelope one at a time.

SUBJECT: Magic with Cards
TITLE: The Rising Cards from Book
DESCRIPTION: A brand new design and presentation for rising cards from a book.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: A playing card is selected and then lost back into the deck. The deck is placed into a book with the top of the deck protruding for all to see. The magician makes a magical pass and the chosen card is seen to have risen mysteriously from the deck.

SUBJECT: Magic with Cards
TITLE: Switching Decks
DESCRIPTION: A simple way to switch a deck during a stand-up show.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: Two playing cards are selected and placed back into the deck. The deck is then put into a box. Another deck is on the table. The cards are removed from the box and the chosen cards have vanished. They are found in the deck that was on the table.

SUBJECT: Magic with Cards
TITLE: The Phantom Cut-Out Cards
DESCRIPTION: An unusual card revelation that will show everyone you really are cut-out to be a magician after all.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: The magician shows a large sheet of paper with a picture of a deck of cards on it.  He explains that he will make a card rise out of the deck.  A playing card is selected and returned to the deck.  The deck is placed into a box.  The magician makes a magical gesture towards the sheet of paper.  A card slowly rises from the deck.  The card matches the one that was selected.

SUBJECT: Magic with Cards
TITLE: FE Cole's Any Card Called For Rising Card
DESCRIPTION: Any card named rises from the deck of cards.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: A deck of cards is shuffled. A playing card is selected, remembered, and placed back into the deck. The magician waves his hand over the deck and the chosen card rises mysteriously from the deck.

SUBJECT: Magic with Cards
TITLE: Tarbell's Any Card Rising Card
DESCRIPTION: Another method for any named card to rise from a deck of cards.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: A deck of cards is placed into a glass. Any card is named. The magician gestures towards the glass and the named card slowly rises from the deck.

SUBJECT: Oriental Magic
TITLE: Tarbell's Elusive Cannon Crackers
DESCRIPTION: A couple of magical markers that switch places multiple times before ultimately changing color.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: A cannon cracker is lit and placed into a tube. The cracker visibly explodes inside the tube. Upon removing the top of the tube, the cracker is found to be completely restored. The cracker is then removed and lit again. It is placed on a plate where it explodes. The cracker is then found inside a small sack. The cracker is lit a third time and placed back into the tube. The tube is covered and the cracker explodes. When the tube is uncovered, the cracker has vanished.

SUBJECT: Oriental Magic
TITLE: The Hindu Climbing Balls
DESCRIPTION: An odd demonstration of physics.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: Three balls are used. Two are placed on a cord and the third is put away. The two balls are placed into a hat. The third ball is seen to have joined the other two. The balls are removed from the hat and again two are placed on the cord and the third is put away. The two are placed into the hat and again the third ball joins the other two. The balls are removed and the effect is repeated for a third time.

SUBJECT: Oriental Magic
TITLE: The Hindu Jar of Grain
DESCRIPTION: Peanuts and chocolate chips are mixed together in a bag, and magically transform into peanut butter cups.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: A jar is filled with grain. A small glass is also shown and then placed mouth down into the grain. The glass is removed and is seen to be filled with the grain. The grain is dumped back into the jar. The glass is again placed into the jar and removed. This time, when the glass is lifted out, it is seen to be filled with water. The water is dumped back into the jar. For the final phase, the glass is again placed into the jar. This time, when it is removed, it is seen to be filled with grain and on top of the grain is a large die. The grain is dumped out and the die is removed. The jar is now seen to be completely empty.

SUBJECT: Oriental Magic
TITLE: The Hindu Disappearing Grain
DESCRIPTION: Transform an entire box of bran cereal into a beer!
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: A bowl is filled with grain. The grain is poured into a bag. The bag is turned inside out and the grain has vanished.

SUBJECT: Oriental Magic
TITLE: Chinese Color-Changing Coins
DESCRIPTION: A stack of 1 dollar poker chips visibly increase in value until they all turn into $100.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: The magician shows a Chinese coin that is about an inch and a half in diameter.  He shows both of his hands to be empty, then places the coin in his right hand.  He makes a magical gesture and opens his hand to reveal that the coin is now a different color.  This is repeated a couple of times, the coin changing colors each time.  Finally, the magician places the coin in his left hand.  He closes his hand into a fist.  When he opens his hand, the coin has vanished.

SUBJECT: Oriental Magic
TITLE: The Chinese Sticks
DESCRIPTION: A classic of comedic conjuring, and Harlan will even show you how to construct your own set.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: Two sticks about a foot long are shown.  The magician holds one in each hand.  The sticks are solid and appear unprepared.  The magician taps the sticks together.  He holds the sticks so that one is horizontal and the other is vertical.  The magician slides the vertical stick upwards.  The horizontal stick mysteriously clings to the vertical one, seeming to defy gravity.  The magician then slides the stick back down.  He repeats this a couple of times.  For the final phase, the magician slides the vertical stick back down.  He continues moving the stick until it is completely free from the horizontal one.  The horizontal stick then falls to the floor.

SUBJECT: Oriental Magic
TITLE: The Chinese Production Box
DESCRIPTION: A magic top hat disappointingly only produces silk handkerchiefs when what you really want is a whole lot of money.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: A box is shown.  The magician places his hand inside the box and when he removes it, he is holding a playing card.  He then places the card back into the box.  Again, he reaches into the box, but this time when he removes his hand, he is holding a large quantity of playing cards.

SUBJECT: Oriental Magic
TITLE: Mystery of the Paper Ball, Egg, Frog, and Baby Chicken
DESCRIPTION: While attempting a simple translocation of a borrowed bill, a series of unexpected transformations occurs. First, the bill changes into a golf ball, then a bunch of gold coins appear, and finally a mess of worms. Eventually, the signed bill successfully finds its way to its new location.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: The magician shows a piece of paper.  He rolls the paper into a ball.  He waves his hand over the ball and it visibly transforms into an egg.  The egg then transforms into a frog.  The frog then transforms into a baby chicken.  For the final phase, the baby chicken transforms back into the paper ball.

SUBJECT: Magic of the Mind
TITLE: Blindfold Card Reading
DESCRIPTION: You'll learn an underground card cheating technique that allows you to identify selected cards from a truly shuffled deck, while legitimately blindfolded.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: The magician is blindfolded. The spectator cuts the deck. The magician gives the deck a snap and instantly reveals the name of the selected card.

SUBJECT: Magic of the Mind
TITLE: The Devils Deck
DESCRIPTION: Harlan teaches you to make a clever deck of cards that shows you exactly where any named card is, tells you which cards are missing, and helps you find any four-of-a-kind.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: The magician shows a packet of cards that are all different.  The cards are shuffled and handed to a spectator.  The spectator is given a choice of taking a card from the top or bottom of the deck.  The chosen card is placed face down on the table.  The rest of the cards are then shown to be all the same.  The card that was placed on the table is turned over and it matches the other cards.

SUBJECT: Magic of the Mind
TITLE: Bank Night Revised
DESCRIPTION: Harlan's updated spin on the perennial favorite, Bank Night, where everybody wins big money, but you always get to keep the top prize.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: The magician hands a spectator a sealed envelope.  Five other spectators are each given ten playing cards.  The five spectators each select one of their cards.  The magician asks the spectator with the envelope to open it.  Inside is a prediction.  The prediction matches one of the five selected cards.

SUBJECT: Magic of the Mind
TITLE: Dr Bridges' Thought Projection
DESCRIPTION: A word is randomly chosen, and you reveal your prediction is the page number where it appears in the dictionary. Plus, the word is circled!
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: The magician writes a thought on a piece of paper and hands it to a spectator. The spectator concentrates on the thought. The magician then reveals that he knows the spectator's thought.

SUBJECT: Magic of the Mind
TITLE: The Chess Knights Tour
DESCRIPTION: Blindfolded with your head turned away, you're able to call out every move your helper needs to make for a perfect knight's tour of the chessboard.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: The magician has a board with 64 squares, each with a number. A spectator selects a number, and the magician starts with that number to make a Chess Knight's tour of the board, moving the Knight two squares at a time to cover every square in 64 moves, ending at the starting point.

SUBJECT: Magic of the Mind
TITLE: The Tarbell Rapid Memory Act
DESCRIPTION: You'll learn to demonstrate your super-memory skills by instantly recalling twenty random items in any order, forwards or backwards.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: A large chalkboard is displayed with 60 numbers written on it.  The numbers are in random order and the audience is invited to call out any number.  The performer locates the called number instantly.  The audience is then invited to call out any six numbers.  The performer instantly repeats the six numbers, forward and backward, as well as the numbers that come before and after each of the six numbers on the board.

SUBJECT: Rope Magic
TITLE: Tarbell's "Basik" Rope Mystery
DESCRIPTION: quick cut and restored rope effect.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: The performer shows a piece of rope about 36 inches long.  The audience is invited to tie the performer's wrists together with the rope.  The performer's hands are tied together behind his or her back.  The rope is tied tightly with a square knot.  The performer is able to free their hands from the rope in an instant.  They then are able to put their hands back into the rope, tied as before, just as quickly.

SUBJECT: Rope Magic
TITLE: The Lazy Man Reformed
DESCRIPTION: A very convincing display, where the spectator cuts the rope, and a quick restoration.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: A rope is introduced and the magician's wrists are tied together behind their back.  The magician is able to free their hands from the rope almost instantly.  They then put their hands back into the rope, tied as before, just as quickly.

SUBJECT: Rope Magic
TITLE: Henry Holava's Rope from Hand Release
DESCRIPTION: A penetration of a rope wrapped and tied securely around your hand. Strangely, it melts right through with just one sharp snap.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: A rope is introduced and tied securely around the magician's wrists.  The rope is tied behind the magician's back.  The magician is able to free their hands from the rope almost instantly.  They then put their hands back into the rope, tied as before, just as quickly.

SUBJECT: Rope Magic
TITLE: Block of Wood Release
DESCRIPTION: A complete handling of a penetration of a large block of wood off a rope threaded through it. Performed without any cover.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: A rope is introduced and tied securely around the magician's wrists.  A small block of wood is threaded on the rope.  The magician's wrists are tied together behind his or her back.  The magician is able to free their hands from the rope almost instantly.  They then put their hands back into the rope, tied as before, just as quickly.

SUBJECT: Rope Magic
TITLE: The Priest's Pearls
DESCRIPTION: An endless scarf looped around and pulled through the performer's neck for a quick, eye-catching opener.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: A rope is introduced and tied securely around the magician's wrists.  The magician's wrists are tied together behind his or her back.  The magician is able to free their hands from the rope almost instantly.  They then put their hands back into the rope, tied as before, just as quickly.

SUBJECT: Rope Magic
TITLE: Tarbell's Rope Mystery Method 1
DESCRIPTION: A spectator clearly cuts the rope himself into two obviously separate pieces which are tied together and magically melt back into one.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: A rope is introduced and tied securely around the magician's wrists.  The magician's wrists are tied together behind his or her back.  The magician is able to free their hands from the rope almost instantly.  They then put their hands back into the rope, tied as before, just as quickly.

SUBJECT: Rope Magic
TITLE: Tarbell's Rope Mystery Method 2
DESCRIPTION: An electrifying routine with an enchanted power cord that works no matter where you put the plugs.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: A rope is introduced and tied securely around the magician's wrists.  The magician's wrists are tied together behind his or her back.  The magician is able to free their hands from the rope almost instantly.  They then put their hands back into the rope, tied as before, just as quickly.

SUBJECT: Rope Magic
TITLE: Tarbell's Rope Mystery Method 3
DESCRIPTION: An electrifying routine with an enchanted power cord that works no matter where you put the plugs.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: A rope is introduced and tied securely around the magician's wrists.  The magician's wrists are tied together behind his or her back.  The magician is able to free their hands from the rope almost instantly.  They then put their hands back into the rope, tied as before, just as quickly.

SUBJECT: Rope Magic
TITLE: Tarbell's Rope Mystery Method 4
DESCRIPTION: A method allowing you to cut and restore a ribbon not only once, but twice, and end with a completely examinable ribbon.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: A rope is introduced and tied securely around the magician's wrists.  The magician's wrists are tied together behind his or her back.  The magician is able to free their hands from the rope almost instantly.  They then put their hands back into the rope, tied as before, just as quickly.

SUBJECT: Rope Magic
TITLE: Tarbell's Rope Mystery Method 5
DESCRIPTION: A borrowed bill to impossible location. In this case, it ends up in the rope in the spectator's pocket.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: A rope is introduced and tied securely around the magician's wrists.  The magician's wrists are tied together behind his or her back.  The magician is able to free their hands from the rope almost instantly.  They then put their hands back into the rope, tied as before, just as quickly.

SUBJECT: Chalk Talk Magic
TITLE: Animal Twist
DESCRIPTION: You incorrectly guess the animal in a person's mind, but your drawing turns out right after you turn it upside down.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: A drawing of a pig is made on a chalkboard.  The pig is facing to the right.  With a few additional strokes of the chalk, the pig is turned and now faces left.  The pig is turned to the right and left several more times.

SUBJECT: Chalk Talk Magic
TITLE: Guess the Creature
DESCRIPTION: Magician draws a "creature" on a board while audience guesses what it is.  After finishing the drawing, with a twist of the board, the image becomes clear (and an item is magically produced)
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: A drawing of a cat is made on a chalkboard.  The cat is facing to the right.  With a few additional strokes of the chalk, the cat is turned and now faces left.  The cat is turned to the right and left several more times.

SUBJECT: Chalk Talk Magic
TITLE: Rock and Roll High Note
DESCRIPTION: Learn how to animate and bring a drawing to life.  (Axtell.com/magic-drawing-board)
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: Not in Book

SUBJECT: Chalk Talk Magic
TITLE: Dirty Minds
DESCRIPTION: A multi phase mind reading drawing routine perfect for comedy clubs.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: Not in Book

SUBJECT: Chalk Talk Magic
TITLE: The Illusion
DESCRIPTION: A quick sketch of an illusion idea comes to life, successfully performing the illusion in miniature, with the resulting two-dimensional souvenir.
BOOK_DESCRIPTION: A large piece of white paper is displayed on both sides.  With no suspicious moves, a deck of cards is shown and then made to disappear.  The paper is turned over and a large hand is drawn on the back.  The hand is shown to be empty.  The paper is turned over and on the blank side a deck of cards is now drawn.  One of the drawn cards is selected by a spectator.  The selected card is shown to be missing from the drawn deck.  The paper is turned over and the selected card is now pictured in the drawn hand.
